item.title: Why does time move so fast in the Half-Life universe?
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I think the most obvious example of this is where the scientist in HL says “I swear it never swam in terrestrial waters until a week ago” when referring to the Ichthio thing.

Wait, you took that to mean a week had passed in-game?!

That line is one of my favorites. It’s the moment Gordon is verbally introduced to the idea they’ve been doing things with these creatures for a while… and it also expresses how the scientists working with the stuff are also being lied to. That one was smart enough to be skeptical.

Read full topic

item.title: Why does time move so fast in the Half-Life universe?
item.dc:creator: HumanParadoxx
item.description:
I always thought this could happen - the day/night strange cycle - because of the battles could be so intense that Gordon doesn’t really know how much time has passed on each one. He only realizes it’s day or night after an event ends, forgeting to keep track of the time when doing stuff. That could explain this weird cycle.

Read full topic
